name: FEMNET - African Women's Development and Communication Network
goal: In the last 30 years, the African Women’s Development and Communication Network (FEMNET) has been able to inform and mobilize her close to 700 members and partners of and around key issues of concern to our core agenda of realizing gender equality and the rights and empowerment of women and girls in Africa. This has enabled and facilitated collective participation of women in local and global fora to influence key decisions, policies and practices that impact them economically, socially and politically. As a bold feminist and pan-African organization, FEMNET envisions an African society where gender equality is achieved and women and girls enjoy all their rights and live in dignity. (more about FEMNET is available on our website www.femnet.org).
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Climate Action, Communication, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Information Society, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and Technology, Taxation, Trade, Youth
euInitiatives:
FEMNET is a member of the Africa Task Force on the EU Policy Forum for Development (PFD)

FEMNET participates in the annual EU Policy Forum for Development as a strategic platform for networking and influencing decisions and contributing to engendering the discussions and outcomes.

FEMNET signed a Framework Partnership Agreement with the EU in 2017, with a goal to promote a meaningful and structured participation of women in Africa in the design, implementation and monitoring of policies at local, national and regional levels to ensure gender equality,
women's empowerment and the realization of women's and girls' rights.

FEMNET also joins other CSOs in engaging in the EU-Africa Summit.

In 2017, FEMNET with support from EU convened over 190 African women’s rights organization representatives from 34 African countries in Nairobi, Kenya, for the first and biggest pan-African women’s conference since the adoption of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) in 2015. The Resulting Strategic Roadmap is geared towards safeguarding and cultivating gains around gender equality and women's rights.
